file_content.text: General, I've arrived on Nar Shaddaa. Still no word from Agent Galen?
Negative. After Taris and Ord Mantell, I fear the worst.
Negative. Considering what you learned on Ord Mantell, we're probably confronting a worst-case scenario.
I'll warn you now, the project there is... I should've ended it years ago.
Conversations like this never end well.
After the Empire's victory on Coruscant during the war, people were terrified. We looked weak, helpless.
The Senate authorized research into science we had no business exploring--using technology to turn ordinary men into living weapons.
The "Power Guard" program was creating the ultimate soldier. One tough enough to fight a Sith head-on.
The best defense against a Sith is someone like me.
But you already have Jedi.
Your order was nearly extinct. The Senate feared you might never recover.
I was expecting something that could threaten a whole planet.
Not much of a superweapon.
Think how much damage a lone Jedi can do. Now multiply that by thousands--or millions.
The Sith have the Force on their side. No ordinary soldier can match that.
You underestimate Sith.
We're closer than you might think.
Nar Shaddaa has the latest advances in cybernetics, combat adrenals, personal armor and weapons. Everything we need to create the Power Guards.
T7 combat upgrades = manufactured on Nar Shaddaa // Finest quality!
There's also a distinct lack of government oversight. You're in Hutt territory--neutral space. Laws are practically nonexistent.
This is against everything the Republic stands for.
Good people don't belong here.
I tried to distance us from the corruption. Thought I could keep us clean.
It's my first visit to Hutt Space. What do you know about them?
Tell me about the Hutts.
Hutts break laws just breathing--but they let us do our business, no questions asked.
The fewer rules I have to deal with, the better.
Just the way I like it.
That's what we thought when we started this mess.
I placed a single operative in charge of the Power Guard project. Gave him unlimited authority and enough credits to fund the program.
The research facility operates in absolute secrecy. I don't even know where it is.
Darth Angral's henchman on Coruscant said all our research facilities were compromised.
The enemy does.
If you don't know where the research facility is, how can Angral find it?
Are you sure it's been lost?
Our operative's name and contact data were in the file stolen on Coruscant.
You should've spent less time worrying about your blasted reputation.
What a silly security measure.
I told myself I was protecting the Republic.
Regardless, Darth Angral learned our operative's name and contact data from the file stolen on Coruscant.
Our operative has disappeared, and Agent Galen vanished trying to find him. I can only assume they're dead or captured.
If they're alive, I'll save them--but what about the weapons project?
I won't give up hope.
Our research can die, for all I care.
With nothing to go on, how will I find this facility?
So what now?
You won't be hunting alone.
I'll hunt down Angral's people. They won't live to regret this.
The enemy will pay.
Your top priority is shutting down the Power Guard project.
I need you to coordinate with the Strategic Information Service branch on Nar Shaddaa. The bureau chief's name is Rieekan.
SIS headquarters is hidden on the Promenade. You'll visit a merchant shop and use a secret turbolift in the back to meet with Rieekan.
Promenade, shop, secret turbolift--got it. I feel like a spy already.
Understood.
What should I know about this Promenade area?
Tell me about the Promenade.
It's the center of commerce. You'll be rubbing shoulders with all sorts there--even the enemy--but the Hutts don't permit violence.
With Agent Galen missing, how can you guarantee that headquarters is safe?
You're sure it's secure?
The Promenade is a secure zone under constant patrol. The Hutts don't tolerate violence there.
I'm transmitting the location coordinates and turbolift security code to you. Good luck--Var Suthra out....
